Dispute_Type: Leadership and control of band funds
Legal_Issue: Validity of the November 3, 2002 election under band custom and principles of natural justice
Governing_Law: Band customs, principles of natural justice
Evidence_Assessment: Lack of prior notice, absence of advance nominations, non-secret ballot, limited attendance
Decision_Outcome: Election declared void and of no effect
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to show election violated customs and natural justice
Credibility_Factor: Broad disenfranchisement of band members, deviation from long-standing practices
Legal_Rule: Elections must follow established band customs including notice, nominations, and secret ballots; changes require broad consensus
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness in judicial review of administrative decisions
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide proper notice, nominations, and secret ballot
Grounds_for_Claim: Violation of band customs and natural justice
Review_Standard: Compliance with natural justice and customary electoral procedures
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Procedures were procedurally unfair due to lack of notice and inclusivity
Key_Evidence_Considered: Electoral process details, attendance records, historical customs
Legal_Framework: Customary election practices, principles of natural justice
Court_Result: Reinstatement of original councillors, freeze on band accounts pending appeal
Legal_Rule_Source: Common law principles of natural justice, Indigenous band customs
Defendant_Response: Not explicitly stated, but implied defense of election validity
Evidence_Type: Documentary and testimonial evidence on electoral process
Remedy_Requested: Declaration of election invalidity, reinstatement, account freeze
Outcome: Election voided, original councillors reinstated, accounts frozen
Remedy_Sought: Judicial review, declaratory relief, interim injunction
Legal_Provision: Principles of natural justice, customary electoral rules
Authority: Court jurisdiction over federal Indigenous matters
Claimant_Status: Duly elected councillors ousted by disputed election
Legal_Provision_Cited: Implied: Natural justice, band custom as unwritten law
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Allegation of procedural irregularities and lack of consensus
Jurisdiction: Federal court or administrative tribunal with authority over First Nations elections
Governing_Rule: Customary election procedures requiring notice, nominations, secret ballot
